commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: *Siiigh*

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's a pretty deep sigh there, Kasumi.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Well, yeah. We were just a club of five, and now we need ten members? I mean, I got caught up in the moment and said I'd do it, but... *Siiiiigh*

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: And the worst part of it is... *Sigh* The way how even when I'm sighing like this, I'm just so cute.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Ah, ahaha...

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Hey, you thought I was weird just now, didn't you?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh? No, not at all. I was just thinking about how a school idol really needs confidence in her own appeal, like you just now.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I mean, no one's going to like you if you can't like yourself, right?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: ...You're a little strange, you know that?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Huh? I-I am?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Yeah. I mean, no one's ever told me that before.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We're a pair of weirdoes, then.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Ehehe. Well, let's put those weird brains to use! It's time for a strategy meeting!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: All right, I've got no idea what pruned the club like this, so could you fill me in on the timeline?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Sure! Ask me anything!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: But let me start from the beginning. The school idol club started with five members.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Setsuna Yuki, who I talked about earlier, and students from other schools...

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: ...Kanata Konoe, Shizuku Osaka, and Emma Verde.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: And me, Kasumi Nakasu, the rising rookie and cutest of the club.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Got it.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Kanata, Shizuko and Emma transferred to Nijigasaki from other schools just to join our school idol club.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So they were passionate enough to transfer schools.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Then...why?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Yeah, good question. I mean, I'm sure everyone was just as passionate as I am, but we kind of...fell apart midway?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You guys had a falling out?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Oh, well, not exactly. I think we all got along really well. There wasn't anyone I disliked or anything.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: But the president said that Setsuna fractured the club, right?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Well, I had a teensy tiny bit of an issue with Setsuna, but it's not like I didn't like her, or like she did anything wrong.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: And she did give me a lot of advice, you know? But sometimes, I kind of...disagreed, right? Thought something was off?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You mean her advice was wrong?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Well, not exactly, it's more like...it wasn't quite what I was after.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Setsuna's really amazing, though. She was a real leader, and I felt like I really wanted to follow her.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: But looking back, I feel like we were all just...really different.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Remember how there was that club presentation fair?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Oh yeah, I remember that. Wait. Was the school idol club in it?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: No, we weren't.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: We wanted to put on a show as a group, of course. It was going to be our first ever show, so we were all so excited.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Only problem was, what we wanted to do was so all over the place we couldn't decide on anything.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Someone wanted to put in dialogue, another wanted animals on stage, someone else wanted it to be like a musical...

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: And that's when I realized that we weren't all on the same page. That's why we ended up on guard around each other.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Setsuna didn't bring everyone together?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I feel like Setsuna was the most on guard of all. She seemed really low-energy around us.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So the club just...faded away?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: People stopped showing up. It really showed me that it takes more than lots of passion to get things done.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: ...But I think passion is really important. And I don't think Kanata, Shizuku or Emma have lost their passion for school idols, either.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So instead of looking for new members, we should check on our old members and see if they really don't want to come back.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I-I talked a pretty big game in front of the president yesterday, but...will they actually come back?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I wouldn't worry. I mean, you know more than anyone how passion for being a school idol doesn't go away easily, right?

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Huh? Why me?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Well, you were protecting this empty club room because you love school idols, right? You were even practicing all alone...

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: P-Practicing alone?! I-I wasn't...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I can see how hard you've been working. Like from the bandages on your feet, for instance.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: ...You're a little too perceptive.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I think anyone would notice.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I have to wonder about that. Still, let's get going. It's not like we'll lose anything by talking to them.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Hey, Kasumi.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Yes?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Your ears are red.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: No they're not! Now come on, I'll leave you behind if you don't hurry!
